I also want to start a conversation here on how we want to test this.  Certainly I should add test cases here, but I'm unsure of what exactly to test here.

It may make sense, at some point, to tweak the coefficients for outer products and Choleskies in the computation cost estimate, for instance, or to refine the communication cost estimate somehow.  Small, explicit test case with a couple of users and a couple of products that checks for specific values would pose something of a nuisance to whoever is doing that tweaking.  I'm not quite sure how to write a test encapsulating "the asymptotic behaviour of the computation cost ought to look like numRatings \* rank^2 + (users + products) \* rank^3" that wouldn't itself pose such a nuisance.
@marmbrus - do you have more changes or is this good to go?
@pwendell I think this is ready to merge.

@pwendell your one-line fix makes complete sense. Just pushed the changes you suggested. Btw I removed `NoSuchFieldError` since in that context it can't happen, both classes and fields are accessed through reflection.

A linkage error will occur when lets say you have a dependency flagged as _provided_ and your code points to one if its Class fields, for example `MRJobConfig.DEFAULT_MAPREDUCE_APPLICATION_CLASSPATH`. Now since your version of such dependency has that class and field you can compile it. The error is thrown when at runtime the _provided_ `MRJobConfig`  is missing that field, ergo a linkage error.
Awesome thanks Michael! I've seen this in `Class.forName` a bunch of times but never connected the dots that this is what we need. I'll just merge this and drop your change.
